page.title: 08Housing in Woodhalls
page.content: As Woodhalls is in a conservation area the building of new houses and the alteration of old ones is strictly controlled by law. The few dwellings erected in recent years have been soley for the needs of agriculture. Five others were probably built in the late 19th/early 2Oth century.The rest are considerably older,some dating possibly from the 14th century, including several Devon longhouses. Many of the houses are built of stone but others are of cob:- a mixture of clay, gravel and straw. In the present day a cement mixture is used when repairs are necessary. A number of old houses are thatched with straw.Interiors often reveal ancient wooden beams, original bread ovens and huge fireplaces.
